data.title: 08 ~ Early Tollywood
data.meta_description: Early Tollywood is the unique of its kind to feature large number of old actors, actress and movies profiles along with a large collection of photo galleries, wallpapers, latest news, lyrics of songs and reviews.
data.text:
LAILA

Name: Laila

Date of birth: 24th October, 1980

Spouse: Mehdi

Eyes: Black

Hair: Black

Debut Film: Dushman Duniya Ka (Hindi)

Hobbies: Music, playing the violin

Awards: Film fare Best Actress award - 2003

Biography:

Laila, the 'chubby cheeks dimple chin Goan girl' based in Mumbai, started her career as a model. This lovely lass is a trained ballerina from the Royal Academy of Dancing, London; plays the violin and loves music. Her entry into the film industry was accidental. She was into modeling when popular comedian, Mehmood spotted her and she got an offer as the heroine in a Hindi film 'Dushman Duniya Ka' (1996). But the film didn't do well at the box-office. Then she made her debut in the south with the Tamil movie 'Kallazhagar'. Later she starred in movies such as 'Dhil' (2001), 'Nandha'(2001), 'Unnai Ninaithu' etc

n 2003, she fetched the Film fare Best Actress award for her performance in the Tamil film 'Pithamagan', opposite Vikram. After the success of 'Pithamagan', she took a break and went back to Mumbai. But she returned to the silver screen with 'Ullam Ketkume'(2005), in which she did an innocent, tomboy kind of character. Another noted film was 'Kanda Naal Mudhal' (2005), a Prakashraj production, in which she delivered a matured performance.

Her first Telugu film was 'Egire Pavuramma' with Srikanth and JD Chakravarthy. Her career failed to take off in the Telugu Film Industry. Films like 'Subhalekhalu' and 'Ugadi' only added to her woes. This bubbly girl has also done films in Kannada. She did the female lead in the Upendra starrer 'Thande thakka Makka', remake of the Tamil original 'Thevar Magan'. Her Malayalam films lists include 'Itha Oru Snehagatha', 'War and Love' (2003), 'Swapnakoodu' (2003-Guest role), 'Mahasamudram' (2006) etc.

She got married to Mehdi, an Iranian businessman based in Mumbai, on January 6th 2006 and has decided to continue acting in films. Laila has captivated the hearts of movie goers with her natural beauty, dimpled smile, chirpy presence and effervescent acting style. This down to earth gorgeous girl believes that the glitter of the film world does not last forever.

Other Interests: Hobbies : I am into a lot of things and of recent it is digital photography, it is exciting. I also like playing the violin and enjoy fiddling with computers

Music : I love music

My strength : My ability to stay calm in a situation

Dancing : I am a ballerina. I was trained at the Royal Academy of Dancing, London

Origin and mother tongue : I am a Goanese who speaks English at home

Educational qualification : I am a BA graduate

Cherished moment in life : I have had quite a few cherished moments in life so far

Birthday : My birthday is Oct 24th, a Scorpio

Favorite food : I love sambar rice

Favorite actor : I have too many favorite actors, to mention a few from the top of my head - Pierce Brosnan and Sean Connery

Acting after marriage? I will definitely give up acting after marriage.

Love animals? I love animals and it is one of my goals in life to become an animal activist

Trivia:

She likes playing the violin and enjoy fiddling with computers

She is a ballerina. she was trained at the Royal Academy of Dancing, London

She is a Goanese who speaks English at home

She is a BA graduate

Her birthday is Oct 24th, a Scorpio

Mahasamudram

Name: Tabu

Birth Name: Tabassum Hashmi

Birth Date: November 4, 1970

Birth Place: Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India

Sex: F

Height: 5' 8½" (1.74 m)

Nationality: Indian

Profession: Actress

Father:Jamal Hashmi

Mother: Rizwana

Sister: Farha {Actress}

Aunt: Shabana Azmi

Biography:

Tabu (born Tabassum Hashmi on November 4, 1970) is an Indian actress. Largely considered one of the Indian film industry's best actresses working today, Tabu "Tabassum Hashmi" (born in Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh) has won the coveted National Film Award for Best Actress twice - once for Maachis (1996) and most recently for Chandni Bar (2002). She has also won three statuettes in the Filmfare Critics Award for Best Performance category for Virasat (1997), Hu Tu Tu (1999), and Astitva (2000) respectively and in 1995 she was awarded with the Filmfare Best Debut Award

Despite a few exceptions, Tabu is known best for her willingness to play characters in artistic, low-budget films that go on to garner more critical appreciation than they do substantial box office figures (such as in Meenaxi: A Tale of Three Cities or Maqbool). She has acted in a number of Telugu movies, many of them very successful, such as Coolie No. 1, Ninne Pelladatha etc. She is the niece of Shabana Azmi and the younger sister of actress Farha. In 2006 she starred alongside Kajol and Aamir Khan in Kunal Kohli's latest film, Fanaa. She is the life member of International Film And Television Club of Asian Academy Of Film & Television,Noida.

Tabu Awards and Achievements :

Awards of the International Indian Film Academy

2002: Won Popular Award for Actress in a Leading Role for: Chandni Bar (2001)

Zee Cine Awards

2002: Won Popular Award for Best Actress for: Chandni Bar (2001)

National Film Awards, India

2002: Won Silver Lotus Award for Best Actress for: Chandni Bar (2001)

1997 Won Silver Lotus Award for Best Actress for: Maachis (1996)

Screen Weekly Awards

2001: Won Screen Award for Best Actress for: Astitva (2000)

Filmfare Awards

2001: Won Filmfare Award for Best Actress - Critics for: Astitva (2000)

2000: Won Filmfare Award for Best Actress - Critics for: Hu Tu Tu (1999)

1998: Won Filmfare Award for Best Actress - Critics for: Virasat (1997)

1995: Won Filmfare Award for Best Newcomer
